title: Associate Pastor Interview
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews ending with a panel interview including a number of people I had never met. I got the impression this style of interviewing was new to most of the people conducting the interview. There was a large group of applicants and it was set up almost like you would think speed dating would be. 5 or so minutes with two or three people.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for a church?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Interview Descriptions: Last, summer I worked at Country Club of Virginia. The task I performed was mowing greens and general maintenance of a top 5 golf course in Virginia, and a top 50 country club in the United States. At CCV, I had to use superior customer service with the members because they expected the best.

title: Children's Ministry Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CCV (San Dimas, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It my take a while from application to interview. As a whole it looks like the entire hiring process takes a while. There was a phone call then an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your your personal walk with Christ.

title: Cafe Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CCV (Peoria, AZ) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy friendly, go in with a strong will to work there and have knowledge and a commitment to Christ, and you'll bet words the top of the pile.  The interviewers are always friendly, and don't seem imposing or scary at all.
Interview Questions: Have you ever volunteered with CCV
